Title: Object: Général en chef
Description: Portrait of Bonaparte as general of the Republican army; bust-length, in profile to right, sporting long hair with ribbon tied at the back, and wearing a jacket with high collar; on white ground; illustration to Reybaud's "Histoire scientifique et militaire de l'expédition française en Égypte" (Paris: Denain, 1830-36) Etching
Curator's comments: A photomechanical print kept with this impression notes that the drawing was made by Dutertre 'on board the Orient during the passage to Egypt, 1798. The original is in the Bibliothèque Nationale'. The original is now in fact at Malmaison (MM 40.47.4678; see 'Nelson and Napoleon', National Maritime Museum, 2005, cat. 50)
Bibliographic references: IFF / Inventaire du Fonds Français: Bibliothèque Nationale, Département des Estampes (4)
De Vinck 1909-1967 / Collection De Vinck. Un siècle d'histoire de France par l'estampe. Inventaire analytique. (not described)
Associated names: Portrait of: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Associated titles: Histoire scientifique et militaire de l'expédition française en Égypte
Acquisition name: Donated by: David Alexander Edward Lindsay, 27th Earl of Crawford and 10th Earl of Balcarres
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: James Ludovic Lindsay, 26th Earl of Crawford
Acquisition notes: 1925,1214.4 to 140 consists of portraits of Napoleonic generals and other such persons. The prints all come from the collection of the donor's father, and the gift consists of lots bought in at the sale of that collection at Sotheby's 1/2 December 1925.
